Articles.Content:
How the hell can i discharge parts of my rockets e.g: Fuel tanks when they are empty

Answer Me And Earn A Cookie:)
Define your use of the word "discharge".

Check the "structural" menu for stack separators and decouplers.

There's also a list of them here: [http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts#Decoupler_and_Separator](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Parts#Decoupler_and_Separator)

Use decouplers to separate your fuel tanks that run out of fuel. There are both radial and stack decouplers. The stack ones should be placed in between the fuel tank and the part above it. The radial ones should be put on the side of parts and then fuel tanks mounted on them. They can be activated through staging once your fuel has run out.

Where is my cookie?
Or you just can slam 'em hard enough into something. Do 'discharging' with style and explosions.

Have a look at the first few chapters of my 'Exploring' tutorial (link in signature) - Chapter 2 is for learning the flight controls, which you probably don't need, Chapter 3 is all about basic staging strategies (stack, radial and parallel).
